ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you do this activity when you were not using alcohol or drugs - Spending in person time socializing or engaging in any other activities with friends
Notes: 0=0 times; 1=Once a week; 2=2-4 times a week; 3=About once a day; 4=More than once a day

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how much did you enjoy this activity when you were not using alcohol or drugs - Spending in person time socializing or engaging in any other activities with friends
Notes: 0=Unpleasant or neutral; 1=Mildly pleasant; 2=Moderately pleasant; 3=Very pleasant; 4=Extremely pleasant

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, did you have the opportunity to engage in this activity as much as you would like to in the past month - Spending in person time socializing or engaging in any other activities with friends
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: In a typical week in the past 30 days, how many total hours do you spend on this activity when you were not drinking alcohol or using drugs - Spending in person time socializing or engaging in any other activities with friends
Notes: Number of hours
